requirement_tested: Frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: A visitor interested in reading startup stories.
user_goal: To browse and read articles fetched dynamically from the backend.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the mini-program and expects to see a list of articles loaded from the backend.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL in browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Homepage renders with articles fetched dynamically via `/api/articles` endpoint.

requirement_tested: Backend server connecting to external PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables
user_goal: Ensure backend connects securely to PostgreSQL using correct env vars.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: Developer starts the backend service expecting it to connect to PostgreSQL using predefined environment variables.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in project root.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server logs confirm successful connection to PostgreSQL using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc.

requirement_tested: User registration functionality with account creation
user_persona: A new user wanting to join the community.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Registration Page
narrative_steps.description: Alex clicks on the Register link and fills out the form.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to `/register`, fill in username, email, password, and click Submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New user is created in the database and redirected to login or home page.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Jordan enters their credentials and submits the login form.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in email and password on login page, then click Submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: JWT token is issued and stored in HTTP-only cookie; user is redirected to dashboard.

requirement_tested: Article browsing interface organized by categories
user_persona: A reader looking for content in specific topics.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Categories
narrative_steps.description: Taylor sees available categories and selects one to filter articles.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only articles tagged under 'Startup Funding' are displayed.

requirement_tested: Search functionality to find articles by keywords
user_persona: A curious reader seeking specific information.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Casey types 'growth hacking' into the search bar and hits Enter.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'growth hacking' in search input field and press Enter key.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: List of articles matching the query is shown via `/api/articles/search?q=growth+hacking`.

requirement_tested: Article collection feature allowing users to save favorites
user_persona: An avid reader building a personal library.
user_goal: Save an interesting article to their collection.

narrative_steps.title: Collecting Article
narrative_steps.description: Morgan finds an inspiring article and decides to save it.
narrative_steps.action: Click the empty heart icon next to the article titled 'Bootstrapping Success'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Heart icon turns filled, and article ID is added to user's collection via API call.

requirement_tested: Article sharing capability to external platforms
user_persona: A user who loves to spread good reads.
user_goal: Share an article they found insightful.

narrative_steps.title: Sharing Article
narrative_steps.description: Riley wants to share an article about remote work culture on LinkedIn.
narrative_steps.action: Click the share icon below the article and choose LinkedIn option.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: LinkedIn share dialog opens with pre-filled article link.

requirement_tested: Reading history tracking for logged-in users
user_persona: A frequent reader revisiting past reads.

narrative_steps.title: Reading an Article
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks on an article to read more details.
narrative_steps.action: Click on article titled 'Building MVP Fast'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Article view triggers silent API call to record reading history in background.

requirement_tested: User profile management for collection and history access
user_persona: A registered user organizing their reading experience.
user_goal: Manage saved articles and reading history from a central location.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Profile Page
narrative_steps.description: Pat navigates to their profile to review collections and reading history.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the Profile link in navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Profile page loads showing 'My Collections' and 'Reading History' sections populated from backend.

requirement_tested: Responsive layout styled with old lace background and rosy brown interface elements
user_goal: Experience visually appealing UI consistent with brand colors.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Layout Design
narrative_steps.description: Dana visits the homepage and notices the overall look and feel.
narrative_steps.action: Open homepage in desktop browser window.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page background is Old Lace (#FDF5E6) and interface components like headers/buttons are Rosy Brown (#BC8F8F).

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with 'install:all' script for simultaneous frontend and backend dependency installation
user_persona: A developer setting up the project locally.
user_goal: Install all dependencies quickly with one command.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Devon clones the repo and runs the install-all script.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run install:all` in terminal at project root.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed concurrently without errors.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with 'dev' script to run frontend and backend concurrently
user_goal: Run both frontend and backend servers together seamlessly.

narrative_steps.title: Running Dev Servers
narrative_steps.description: Elliot needs to develop both frontend and backend simultaneously.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend dev server and backend API server start concurrently, accessible at respective ports.

requirement_tested: Database schema supporting users, articles, categories, collections, and reading history
user_persona: A database administrator reviewing schema design.
user_goal: Verify that database supports core application features.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Schema Structure
narrative_steps.description: Admin inspects the PostgreSQL database structure.
narrative_steps.action: Query database schema using psql or pgAdmin tool.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tables exist: Users, Articles, Categories, Collections, ReadingHistory with proper relationships defined.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for user authentication, article retrieval, search, and user-specific data management
user_persona: A frontend engineer integrating with backend services.
user_goal: Use backend APIs to build interactive features.

narrative_steps.title: Calling Authentication Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: Engineer sends a POST request to register a new user.
narrative_steps.action: Send POST request to `/api/auth/register` with valid payload.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns 201 Created status with user object confirming successful registration.
